You woke up in your bed as usual. Looking on the clock you see it's 9 in the morning. Your parents probably already left for their jobs. As your consciousness was slowly returning, you thought if you had any plans for the day. But you couldn't think of anything. You got up from the bed, and got dressed. Noticing you left the window open for the night, you went to close it. While doing that you saw outside the front of your house. Right across the street you could see the house of Chloe. You knew her since childhood, and always had a crush on her. You never had courage to tell her that though... also you were worried what would she think about your foot fetish. But it wasn't the time to worry about that, for the first time in a while you have a completely free day!
You wonder what should you do...

111.content:
Before you had even decided what to do with yourself, the doorbell rang unexpectedly. Opening the door, your surprise intensified and your heart skipped a beat at who was standing there. Chloe!

"Hey Owen! What you up to?" Chloe was looking gorgeous as usual. There seemed to be a slight flicker of excitement in her eyes; of course, this may just have been wishful thinking on your part...

"Uh, hey!" You had been caught off guard as the words seemed to stick in your mouth a little. "Um nothing! Nothing at all! Er...do you wanna come in?" You wished you had been all cool and suave, however being in Chloe's presence, especially when she had turned up out of the blue, had softened your insides somewhat.

"Sure,' she smiled, walking past you, her light brown hair almost swishing into your face. Automatically, you breathed in her scent: fruity, sweet, slightly intoxicating! Your legs feeling a lot like jelly, you followed her in.

Chloe walked straight through to your living room, sitting down elegantly on your couch. A little awkwardly, you moved to sit beside her.

"Er...so...nice weather, huh?" You felt almost infuriated with yourself at such a feeble attempt at conversation.

She smiled at you politely. Not giving you any more than this, you started to feel a little panicked at the thought that you could be ruining what could be the perfect chance to prove that you were a decent, fun guy. Not a schmuck who talks about the weather! In the corner of your eye, you noticed her skipping her shoes off, revealing her purple-socked feet. You gulped a little and tried your best to ignore them. The last thing you wanted was Chloe discovering your foot fetish!

"So...what brings you here?" It's the only thing you could think of as you felt your heart beat ever rapidly, almost through your chest.

She frowned at you. "What's wrong? Don't you want me here, Owen?" Her lips pouted as you felt a fresh wave of alarm spread through you.

"No, no!" You babbled. "I didn't mean-"

"I'm kidding, Owen," she smiled gently at you, a playful expression on her face. Relief finally set in and actually made you feel a little more at ease!

"So...what d'you wanna do?" You said as causally as possible, hoping that Chloe hadn't read too much into your babbling just now.

11131.content:
To your shock, Chloe suddenly placed a hand on your arm, sending a few shock waves to ripple inside you.

"It's something...I just need to talk about it to someone...do you mind, Owen?" Her eyes were wide and as pretty as ever.

"Of course!" You said eagerly; the idea that Chloe would want to talk to you about something of a personal nature like this surely meant that she liked or trusted you. Or both!

You gulped. Without warning, both of Chloe's feet thrust forward on the carpet, forcing your eyes to become firmly glued to them. Her soft purple socks had patterns on them and seemed to fit pretty tightly to her feet.

"It's my feet," she said with a sigh. "Some of the girls at school said I have really weird feet, and it's been bugging me for a couple of weeks now. I just had to talk to someone about it - I hope you don't mind?" She gave you a slightly nervous look, which you quickly assuaged with an encouraging smile.

"N-no, it's t-totally fine!" You breathed heavily. Hopefully she was too focused on explaining her so-called problem to notice the fact that you were visibly excited at the mere sight of her socked feet. You couldn't imagine how these slender, obviously attractive looking feet could possible be considered "weird"...

"Thanks," she smiled warmly. "It sounds odd, but I had a feeling that you would understand somehow. Y'know?" You didn't really know but you nodded all the same.

At this point you started to feel conflicted. On the one hand, you felt uncontrollably fascinated by the fact your gorgeous crush was even talking about her feet. At the same time, you were becoming increasingly wary that she might notice your - which seemed to you - obvious excitement about the situation. The combination of having a foot fetish and your crush in close proximity was proving hard for you to think and act logically...

11132.content:
Chloe answered your question with a sigh, "Well Owen I actually came over for a reason."

Interestingly enough she now looked a little nervous. What was her reason for coming over and why was she nervous? Was she going to say that she liked you? You didn't dare hope but the thought wouldn't leave your mind.

"You see... I really like this guy and he likes me too but the problem is he is a bit of a bad boy."

Your fantasies crashed down all around you. She didn't like you, she liked someone else! And not only that but you were apparently so 'friend zoned' that she though tit was OK to talk to you about her dating life!

"Um well what do you mean he's a bad boy?"

Chloe again looked nervous. "Well he doesn't do good in school, in fact he's been suspended from school several times."

You frowned. Something sounded familiar about this.

"And well he's really mean to a lot of people. But I'm sure that's just because he's hiding some secret anguish and just needs a woman to love him properly!"

Was she crazy? Ugh you hated the fact that girls like bad boys and not studious students like yourself! It just wasn't fair.

"So why are you telling me this? Do you need advice?"

Chloe laughed nervously. "Oh no I've already made my decision, I am going to date him. I just don't want to ruin our friendship."

Now alarm bells were starting to ring.

"What do you mean ruin our friendship? Why would you dating someone ruin our friendship?"

Chloe looked down and then looked straight into your eyes. "It's because I'm going to be dating Chad."

For a moment you saw red. Chad. Chad. CHAD?

The fucking bastard who beat you up at school? The Neanderthal who give you a swirly and humiliated you for years? Now that you were older you saw less of him as you were in classes he didn't qualify for and you weren't in the sports classes he was in but as recently as a few months ago he had knocked you down when he saw you in the hall. And for no damned reason. And now the crush, the one you thought was your soul mate was going to date him?

And it was obvious that Chloe wanted you to be OK with it. But can you be OK with it? Can you say that your friendship won't be impacted even if she dates that meat head?
